Row.Text: You have arrived at the Luba Kingdom! I hope you have had a chance to see our markets, for we have the most splendid trade goods in this world.
I may have been defeated, but I will never be forgotten.
You dare challenge me? I will let the historians explain how poor of a decision that is.
You are that rare breed of ruler who I can consider my equal. Shall we mark this occasion with a public Declaration of Friendship?
Your poor behavior will be immortalized in our histories. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
I have decided to make you one of my tributaries. Do not resist too fiercely; this will benefit you as much as it does me.
Your reckless expansion has displaced my tributaries! Thanks to you, they crowd my cities and dirty my streets.
What brings you here? You intend to surrender, I presume?
It is a pleasure to see you. Come, we have carved a stool for you to sit upon.
Greetings! I hope you've been able to purchase all of the salt and metalworks that you desire.
Oh, it's you, from the... hm... give me a second. I need to call the bambudye and have them remind me who you were.
Your military puts on an impressive showing! But my own axes are for more than just show.
Make your offer... but be warned, I am well aware of the value of my goods.
...Perhaps I will urge the bambudye to omit this episode from our official histories.
Your fineries have captured my interest. I would like to introduce them to my own markets; shall we strike a deal?
I will not rest until my triumph is complete.
What resources do your people command? I would like to make an Open Borders treaty and explore them for myself.
Do you think you can out-negotiate me? Ridiculous.
Times are lean for my tributaries. If you would be willing to help us out, your generosity would be long remembered.
Centuries from now, my kingdom will be remembered, but your angry words will be long forgotten.
If you cower so easily at the prospect of battle, you will never be remembered.
This triumph shall be recorded in the "long hand of the pigeon!" I look forward to seeing how my bana balute will speak of it.
